intro: Marsdenia lushaiensis, commonly known as the Lushai Hills Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological and horticultural significance.
